title: Quiz 1: Concepts & Principles of HBC
description: Assessment of fundamental definitions, objectives, and key players in the Home-Based Care system.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines Home-Based Care (HBC) according to the provided text?

options.text: Care provided exclusively by family members without medical supervision
Care of persons with chronic illnesses extended from the hospital to the home through family and community involvement
A short-term hospitalization program for acute illnesses
Care provided strictly in outpatient clinics

questions.explanation: HBC is defined as care extended from the hospital or health facility to the patients' homes through family participation and community involvement within available resources.
questions.hint: Think about the 'continuum of care' from facility to home.

questions.question: Match the Key Player in HBC with their specific role:

richContent.content:
Roles Overview:
Different stakeholders have specific responsibilities in the HBC continuum. Match them correctly.

pairs.right: Participate in care decisions and identify primary caregiver
Train caregivers and provide facilitative supervision
Initiate referral and prepare patient for discharge
Create supportive policy environment and standards

questions.explanation: Patients participate; Teams train/supervise; Health workers initiate/refer; Government sets policy.
questions.hint: Who is responsible for policies vs. who is responsible for the actual discharge?

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized components of comprehensive Home-Based Care? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The four main components are Clinical Care, Nursing Care, Counselling/Psychospiritual Care, and Social Support.
questions.hint: Recall the four pillars mentioned in Section 1.

questions.question: HBC is intended solely for patients who are bedridden and cannot care for themselves.
questions.explanation: HBC concerns those who are sick but still able to care for themselves as well as those who are bedridden.
questions.hint: Does HBC start only when a patient can no longer move?

questions.question: What is the primary rationale for HBC regarding hospital congestion?
questions.explanation: HBC reduces pressure on hospital services/bed occupancy, allowing hospitals to focus on acute short-term care.

questions.question: One principle of HBC is ensuring appropriate, cost-effective access to quality health care to enable persons with ___BLANK___ illnesses to retain their self-sufficiency.
questions.explanation: HBC targets persons living with chronic or terminal illnesses to maintain quality of life.
questions.hint: Long-term diseases like HIV or Cancer.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of HBC for the FAMILY? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Care is less expensive than hospital bills
Prevents separation and holds family together
Reduces the workload of hospital staff

questions.explanation: Reducing hospital staff workload is an advantage for the Health System, not specifically the Family.
questions.hint: Focus on benefits occurring within the household.

questions.question: Which action is part of the 'process of linking patients to support services'?

options.text: Helping patients evaluate agencies that meet their needs
Forcing patients to join specific groups

questions.explanation: The process involves identifying needs, identifying agencies, introducing them, and helping patients evaluate/choose appropriate support.

questions.question: Arrange the levels of care in the continuum from the facility downwards:

items.text: Home Care Team / Community Health Worker

questions.explanation: Care extends from the institution, facilitated by the team/CHW, to the family caregiver, and ultimately empowers the patient.
questions.hint: Start with the most professional setting.

questions.question: HBC aims to replace the need for hospital care entirely.
questions.explanation: HBC does not replace hospital care; it is a continuum of care for chronic conditions, relieving pressure but maintaining referral links for acute needs.
questions.hint: Is it a replacement or an extension?
